segment.source: Configure certificate infrastructure
segment.target: Configure certificate infrastructure

segment.source: Configure certificate infrastructure
segment.target: Configure certificate infrastructure

segment.source: This topic describes what you need in order to create and deploy certificate profiles.
segment.target: This topic describes what you need in order to create and deploy certificate profiles.

segment.source: To do any certificate-based authentication in your organization, you need an Enterprise Certification Authority.
segment.target: To do any certificate-based authentication in your organization, you need an Enterprise Certification Authority.

segment.source: To use SCEP certificate profiles, in addition to the Enterprise Certification Authority, you also need:
segment.target: To use SCEP certificate profiles, in addition to the Enterprise Certification Authority, you also need:

segment.source: A server that runs the Network Device Enrollment Service
segment.target: A server that runs the Network Device Enrollment Service

segment.source: The Intune Certificate Connector, which installs on the Windows Server 2012 R2 server that runs NDES
segment.target: The Intune Certificate Connector, which installs on the Windows Server 2012 R2 server that runs NDES

segment.source: To use .PFX Certificate profiles, in addition to the Enterprise Certification Authority, you also need:
segment.target: To use .PFX Certificate profiles, in addition to the Enterprise Certification Authority, you also need:

segment.source: A computer that can communicate with the Certification Authority, or use the Certification Authority computer itself.
segment.target: A computer that can communicate with the Certification Authority, or use the Certification Authority computer itself.

segment.source: The Intune Certificate Connector, which runs on the computer that can communicate with the Certification Authority.
segment.target: The Intune Certificate Connector, which runs on the computer that can communicate with the Certification Authority.

segment.source: On-premises infrastructure
segment.target: On-premises infrastructure

segment.source: Active Directory domain: All servers listed in this section (except for the Web Application Proxy Server) must be joined to your Active Directory domain.
segment.target: Active Directory domain: All servers listed in this section (except for the Web Application Proxy Server) must be joined to your Active Directory domain.

segment.source: Certification Authority (CA): An Enterprise Certification Authority (CA) that runs on an Enterprise edition of or later.
segment.target: Certification Authority (CA): An Enterprise Certification Authority (CA) that runs on an Enterprise edition of or later.

segment.source: A Standalone CA is not supported.
segment.target: A Standalone CA is not supported.

segment.source: For instructions on how to set up a Certification Authority, see Install the Certification Authority.
segment.target: For instructions on how to set up a Certification Authority, see Install the Certification Authority.

segment.source: If your CA runs Windows Server 2008 R2, you must install the hotfix from KB2483564.
segment.target: If your CA runs Windows Server 2008 R2, you must install the hotfix from KB2483564.

segment.source: NDES Server (SCEP only): On a server that runs or later, you must setup up the Network Device Enrollment Service (NDES).
segment.target: NDES Server (SCEP only): On a server that runs or later, you must setup up the Network Device Enrollment Service (NDES).

segment.source: does not support using NDES when it runs on a server that also runs the Enterprise CA.
segment.target: does not support using NDES when it runs on a server that also runs the Enterprise CA.

segment.source: See Network Device Enrollment Service Guidance for instructions on how to configure to host the Network Device Enrollment Service.|
segment.target: See Network Device Enrollment Service Guidance for instructions on how to configure to host the Network Device Enrollment Service.|

segment.source: Computer that can communicate with Certification Authority (.PFX only):Alternatively, use the Certification Authority computer itself.
segment.target: Computer that can communicate with Certification Authority (.PFX only):Alternatively, use the Certification Authority computer itself.

segment.source: Microsoft Intune Certificate Connector: You use the admin console to download the Certificate Connector installer (ndesconnectorssetup.exe).
segment.target: Microsoft Intune Certificate Connector: You use the admin console to download the Certificate Connector installer (ndesconnectorssetup.exe).

segment.source: Then you can run ndesconnectorssetup.exe on the computer where you want to install the Certificate Connector.
segment.target: Then you can run ndesconnectorssetup.exe on the computer where you want to install the Certificate Connector.

segment.source: For .PFX Certificate profiles, install the Certificate Connector on the computer that communicates with the Certification Authority.
segment.target: For .PFX Certificate profiles, install the Certificate Connector on the computer that communicates with the Certification Authority.

segment.source: Web Application Proxy Server (optional): You can use a server that runs or later as a Web Application Proxy (WAP) server.
segment.target: Web Application Proxy Server (optional): You can use a server that runs or later as a Web Application Proxy (WAP) server.

segment.source: This configuration:
segment.target: This configuration:

segment.source: Allows devices to receive certificates using an Internet connection.
segment.target: Allows devices to receive certificates using an Internet connection.

segment.source: Is a security recommendation when devices connect through the Internet to receive and renew certificates.
segment.target: Is a security recommendation when devices connect through the Internet to receive and renew certificates.

segment.source: The server that hosts WAP must install an update that enables support for the long URLs that are used by the Network Device Enrollment Service.
segment.target: The server that hosts WAP must install an update that enables support for the long URLs that are used by the Network Device Enrollment Service.

segment.source: This update is included with the December 2014 update rollup, or individually from KB3011135.
segment.target: This update is included with the December 2014 update rollup, or individually from KB3011135.

segment.source: Also, the server that hosts WAP must have a SSL certificate that matches the name being published to external clients as well as trust the SSL certificate that is used on the NDES server.
segment.target: Also, the server that hosts WAP must have a SSL certificate that matches the name being published to external clients as well as trust the SSL certificate that is used on the NDES server.

segment.source: These certificates enable the WAP server to terminate the SSL connection from clients, and create a new SSL connection to the NDES server.
segment.target: These certificates enable the WAP server to terminate the SSL connection from clients, and create a new SSL connection to the NDES server.

segment.source: For information about certificates for WAP, see the Plan certificates section of Planning to Publish Applications Using Web Application Proxy.
segment.target: For information about certificates for WAP, see the Plan certificates section of Planning to Publish Applications Using Web Application Proxy.

segment.source: For general information about WAP servers, see Working with Web Application Proxy.|
segment.target: For general information about WAP servers, see Working with Web Application Proxy.|

segment.source: Certificates and Templates
segment.target: Certificates and Templates

segment.source: Object
segment.target: Object

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Certificate Template
segment.target: Certificate Template

segment.source: You configure this template on your issuing CA.
segment.target: You configure this template on your issuing CA.

segment.source: Client authentication certificate
segment.target: Client authentication certificate

segment.source: Requested from your issuing CA or public CA, you install this certificate on the NDES Server.
segment.target: Requested from your issuing CA or public CA, you install this certificate on the NDES Server.

segment.source: Server authentication certificate
segment.target: Server authentication certificate

segment.source: Requested from your issuing CA or public CA, you install and bind this SSL certificate in IIS on the NDES server.
segment.target: Requested from your issuing CA or public CA, you install and bind this SSL certificate in IIS on the NDES server.

segment.source: Trusted Root CA certificate
segment.target: Trusted Root CA certificate

segment.source: You export this as a .cer file from the issuing CA or any device which trusts the issuing CA, and deploy it to devices by using the Trusted CA certificate profile.
segment.target: You export this as a .cer file from the issuing CA or any device which trusts the issuing CA, and deploy it to devices by using the Trusted CA certificate profile.

segment.source: You use a single Trusted Root CA certificate per operating system platform, and associate it with each Trusted Root Certificate profile you create.
segment.target: You use a single Trusted Root CA certificate per operating system platform, and associate it with each Trusted Root Certificate profile you create.

segment.source: You can use additional Trusted Root CA certificates when needed.
segment.target: You can use additional Trusted Root CA certificates when needed.

segment.source: For example, you might do this to provide a trust to a CA that signs the server authentication certificates for your Wi-Fi access points.
segment.target: For example, you might do this to provide a trust to a CA that signs the server authentication certificates for your Wi-Fi access points.

segment.source: Accounts
segment.target: Accounts

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: NDES service account
segment.target: NDES service account

segment.source: You specify a domain user account to use as the NDES Service account.
segment.target: You specify a domain user account to use as the NDES Service account.

segment.source: Configure your infrastructure
segment.target: Configure your infrastructure

segment.source: Before you can configure certificate profiles you must complete the following tasks, which require knowledge of Windows Server 2012 R2 and Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS):
segment.target: Before you can configure certificate profiles you must complete the following tasks, which require knowledge of Windows Server 2012 R2 and Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS):

segment.source: Task 1 - Configure certificate templates on the certification authority
segment.target: Task 1 - Configure certificate templates on the certification authority

segment.source: Task 2, for SCEP profile only:
segment.target: Task 2, for SCEP profile only:

segment.source: - Configure prerequisites on the NDES server
segment.target: - Configure prerequisites on the NDES server

segment.source: Task 3, for SCEP profile only:
segment.target: Task 3, for SCEP profile only:

segment.source: - Configure NDES for use with
segment.target: - Configure NDES for use with

segment.source: Task 4 - Enable, install, and configure the Intune Certificate Connector
segment.target: Task 4 - Enable, install, and configure the Intune Certificate Connector

segment.source: Task 1 - Configure certificate templates on the certification authority
segment.target: Task 1 - Configure certificate templates on the certification authority

segment.source: In this task you will:
segment.target: In this task you will:

segment.source: Create a NDES service account
segment.target: Create a NDES service account

segment.source: To revoke certificates the NDES service account needs Issue and Manage Certificates rights for each certificate template used by a certificate profile.
segment.target: To revoke certificates the NDES service account needs Issue and Manage Certificates rights for each certificate template used by a certificate profile.

segment.source: Configure a certificate template for NDES
segment.target: Configure a certificate template for NDES

segment.source: Publish the certificate template for NDES
segment.target: Publish the certificate template for NDES

segment.source: To configure the certification authority
segment.target: To configure the certification authority

segment.source: Create a domain user account to use as the NDES service account.
segment.target: Create a domain user account to use as the NDES service account.

segment.source: You will specify this account when you configure templates on the issuing CA before you install and configure NDES.
segment.target: You will specify this account when you configure templates on the issuing CA before you install and configure NDES.

segment.source: On the issuing CA, use the Certificate Templates snap-in to create a new custom template or copy an existing template and then edit an existing template (like the User template), for use with NDES.
segment.target: On the issuing CA, use the Certificate Templates snap-in to create a new custom template or copy an existing template and then edit an existing template (like the User template), for use with NDES.

segment.source: The template must have the following configurations:
segment.target: The template must have the following configurations:

segment.source: Specify a friendly Template display name for the template.
segment.target: Specify a friendly Template display name for the template.

segment.source: On the Subject Name tab, select Supply in the request.
segment.target: On the Subject Name tab, select Supply in the request.

segment.source: (Security is enforced by the policy module for NDES).
segment.target: (Security is enforced by the policy module for NDES).

segment.source: On the Extensions tab, ensure the Description of Application Policies includes Client Authentication.
segment.target: On the Extensions tab, ensure the Description of Application Policies includes Client Authentication.

segment.source: For iOS and Mac OS X certificate templates, on the Extensions tab, edit Key Usage and ensure Signature is proof of origin is not selected.
segment.target: For iOS and Mac OS X certificate templates, on the Extensions tab, edit Key Usage and ensure Signature is proof of origin is not selected.

segment.source: On the Security tab, add the NDES service account, and give it Enroll permissions to the template.
segment.target: On the Security tab, add the NDES service account, and give it Enroll permissions to the template.

segment.source: Review the Validity period on the General tab of the template.
segment.target: Review the Validity period on the General tab of the template.

segment.source: By default, uses the value configured in the template.
segment.target: By default, uses the value configured in the template.

segment.source: However, you have the option to configure the CA to allow the requester to specify a different value, which you can then set from within the Administrator console.
segment.target: However, you have the option to configure the CA to allow the requester to specify a different value, which you can then set from within the Administrator console.

segment.source: If you want to always use the value in the template, skip the remainder of this step.
segment.target: If you want to always use the value in the template, skip the remainder of this step.

segment.source: The iOS and Mac OS X platforms always uses the value set in the template regardless of other configurations you make.
segment.target: The iOS and Mac OS X platforms always uses the value set in the template regardless of other configurations you make.

segment.source: To configure the CA to allow the requester to specify the validity period, on the CA run the following commands:
segment.target: To configure the CA to allow the requester to specify the validity period, on the CA run the following commands:

segment.source: certutil -setreg Policy\EditFlags +EDITF_ATTRIBUTEENDDATE
segment.target: certutil -setreg Policy\EditFlags +EDITF_ATTRIBUTEENDDATE

segment.source: net stop certsvc
segment.target: net stop certsvc

segment.source: net start certsvc
segment.target: net start certsvc

segment.source: On the issuing CA, use the Certification Authority snap-in to publish the certificate template.
segment.target: On the issuing CA, use the Certification Authority snap-in to publish the certificate template.

segment.source: Select the Certificate Templates node, click Action-> New > Certificate Template to Issue, and then select the template you created in step 2.
segment.target: Select the Certificate Templates node, click Action-> New > Certificate Template to Issue, and then select the template you created in step 2.

segment.source: Validate that the template published by viewing it under the Certificate Templates folder.
segment.target: Validate that the template published by viewing it under the Certificate Templates folder.

segment.source: For .PFX profiles: on the CA computer ensure that the computer that hosts the Intune Certificate Connector has enroll permission, so that it can access the template used in creating the .PFX profile.
segment.target: For .PFX profiles: on the CA computer ensure that the computer that hosts the Intune Certificate Connector has enroll permission, so that it can access the template used in creating the .PFX profile.

segment.source: Set that permission on the Security tab of the CA computer properties.
segment.target: Set that permission on the Security tab of the CA computer properties.

segment.source: Task 2 (SCEP profile only) - Configure prerequisites on the NDES server
segment.target: Task 2 (SCEP profile only) - Configure prerequisites on the NDES server

segment.source: In this task you will:
segment.target: In this task you will:

segment.source: Add NDES to a Windows Server and configure IIS to support NDES
segment.target: Add NDES to a Windows Server and configure IIS to support NDES

segment.source: Add the NDES Service account to the IIS_IUSR group
segment.target: Add the NDES Service account to the IIS_IUSR group

segment.source: Set the SPN for the NDES Service account
segment.target: Set the SPN for the NDES Service account

segment.source: To configure prerequisites for the NDES Server
segment.target: To configure prerequisites for the NDES Server

segment.source: On the server that will hosts NDES, you must log on as a an Enterprise Administrator, and then use the Add Roles and Features Wizard to install NDES:
segment.target: On the server that will hosts NDES, you must log on as a an Enterprise Administrator, and then use the Add Roles and Features Wizard to install NDES:

segment.source: In the Wizard, select Active Directory Certificate Services to gain access to the AD CS Role Services.
segment.target: In the Wizard, select Active Directory Certificate Services to gain access to the AD CS Role Services.

segment.source: Select the Network Device Enrollment Service, uncheck Certification Authority, and then complete the wizard.
segment.target: Select the Network Device Enrollment Service, uncheck Certification Authority, and then complete the wizard.

segment.source: On the Installation progress page of the wizard, do not click Close.
segment.target: On the Installation progress page of the wizard, do not click Close.

segment.source: Instead, click the link for Configure Active Directory Certificate Services on the destination server.
segment.target: Instead, click the link for Configure Active Directory Certificate Services on the destination server.

segment.source: This opens the AD CS Configuration wizard that you use for the next task.
segment.target: This opens the AD CS Configuration wizard that you use for the next task.

segment.source: After AD CS Configuration opens, you can close the Add Roles and Features wizard.
segment.target: After AD CS Configuration opens, you can close the Add Roles and Features wizard.

segment.source: When NDES is added to the server, the wizard also installs IIS.
segment.target: When NDES is added to the server, the wizard also installs IIS.

segment.source: Ensure IIS has the following configurations:
segment.target: Ensure IIS has the following configurations:

segment.source: Web Server > Security > Request Filtering
segment.target: Web Server > Security > Request Filtering

segment.source: Web Server > Application Development > ASP.NET 3.5.
segment.target: Web Server > Application Development > ASP.NET 3.5.

segment.source: Installing ASP.NET 3.5 will install .NET Framework 3.5.
segment.target: Installing ASP.NET 3.5 will install .NET Framework 3.5.

segment.source: When installing .NET Framework 3.5, install both the core .NET Framework 3.5 feature and HTTP Activation.
segment.target: When installing .NET Framework 3.5, install both the core .NET Framework 3.5 feature and HTTP Activation.

segment.source: Web Server > Application Development > ASP.NET 4.5.
segment.target: Web Server > Application Development > ASP.NET 4.5.

segment.source: Installing ASP.NET 4.5 will install .NET Framework 4.5.
segment.target: Installing ASP.NET 4.5 will install .NET Framework 4.5.

segment.source: When installing .NET Framework 4.5, install the core .NET Framework 4.5 feature, ASP.NET 4.5, and the WCF Services > HTTP Activation feature.
segment.target: When installing .NET Framework 4.5, install the core .NET Framework 4.5 feature, ASP.NET 4.5, and the WCF Services > HTTP Activation feature.

segment.source: Management Tools > IIS 6 Management Compatibility > IIS 6 Metabase Compatibility
segment.target: Management Tools > IIS 6 Management Compatibility > IIS 6 Metabase Compatibility

segment.source: Management Tools > IIS 6 Management Compatibility > IIS 6 WMI Compatibility
segment.target: Management Tools > IIS 6 Management Compatibility > IIS 6 WMI Compatibility

segment.source: On the server, add the NDES service account as a member of the IIS_IUSR group.
segment.target: On the server, add the NDES service account as a member of the IIS_IUSR group.

segment.source: Run the following command to set the SPN of the NDES Service account:
segment.target: Run the following command to set the SPN of the NDES Service account:

segment.source: setspn -s http/<DNS name of NDES Server> <Domain name>\<NDES Service account name>
segment.target: setspn -s http/<DNS name of NDES Server> <Domain name>\<NDES Service account name>

segment.source: For example, if your NDES Server is named Server01, your domain is Contoso.com, and the service account is NDESService, use:
segment.target: For example, if your NDES Server is named Server01, your domain is Contoso.com, and the service account is NDESService, use:

segment.source: setspn –s http/Server01.contoso.com contoso\NDESService
segment.target: setspn –s http/Server01.contoso.com contoso\NDESService

segment.source: Task 3 (SCEP profile only) - Configure NDES for use with
segment.target: Task 3 (SCEP profile only) - Configure NDES for use with

segment.source: In this task you will:
segment.target: In this task you will:

segment.source: Configure NDES for use with the issuing CA
segment.target: Configure NDES for use with the issuing CA

segment.source: Bind the server authentication (SSL) certificate in IIS
segment.target: Bind the server authentication (SSL) certificate in IIS

segment.source: Configure Request Filtering in IIS
segment.target: Configure Request Filtering in IIS

segment.source: To configure NDES for use with
segment.target: To configure NDES for use with

segment.source: On the NDES Server, open the AD CS Configuration wizard and then make the following configurations.
segment.target: On the NDES Server, open the AD CS Configuration wizard and then make the following configurations.

segment.source: If you clicked the link in the previous task, this wizard is already open.
segment.target: If you clicked the link in the previous task, this wizard is already open.

segment.source: Otherwise, open Server Manager to access the post-deployment configuration for Active Directory Certificate Services.
segment.target: Otherwise, open Server Manager to access the post-deployment configuration for Active Directory Certificate Services.

segment.source: On the Role Services Page, select the Network Device Enrollment Service.
segment.target: On the Role Services Page, select the Network Device Enrollment Service.

segment.source: On the Service Account for NDES page, specify the NDES Service Account.
segment.target: On the Service Account for NDES page, specify the NDES Service Account.

segment.source: On the CA for NDES page, click Select, and then select the issuing CA where you configured the certificate template.
segment.target: On the CA for NDES page, click Select, and then select the issuing CA where you configured the certificate template.

segment.source: On the Cryptography for NDES page, set the key length to meet your company requirements.
segment.target: On the Cryptography for NDES page, set the key length to meet your company requirements.

segment.source: On the Confirmation page, click Configure to complete the wizard.
segment.target: On the Confirmation page, click Configure to complete the wizard.

segment.source: After the wizard completes, edit the following registry key on the NDES Server:
segment.target: After the wizard completes, edit the following registry key on the NDES Server:

segment.source: *HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\MSCEP\*
segment.target: *HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\MSCEP\*

segment.source: To edit this key, identify the certificate template's Purpose, as found on its Request Handling tab, and then edit the corresponding entry in the registry by replacing the existing data with the name of the certificate template (not the display name of the template) that you specified in Task 1.
segment.target: To edit this key, identify the certificate template's Purpose, as found on its Request Handling tab, and then edit the corresponding entry in the registry by replacing the existing data with the name of the certificate template (not the display name of the template) that you specified in Task 1.

segment.source: The following table maps the certificate template purpose to the values in the registry:
segment.target: The following table maps the certificate template purpose to the values in the registry:

segment.source: Certificate template Purpose (On the Request Handling tab)
segment.target: Certificate template Purpose (On the Request Handling tab)

segment.source: Registry value to edit
segment.target: Registry value to edit

segment.source: Value seen in the admin console for the SCEP profile
segment.target: Value seen in the admin console for the SCEP profile

segment.source: Signature
segment.target: Signature

segment.source: SignatureTemplate
segment.target: SignatureTemplate

segment.source: Digital Signature
segment.target: Digital Signature

segment.source: Encryption
segment.target: Encryption

segment.source: EncryptionTemplate
segment.target: EncryptionTemplate

segment.source: Key Encipherment
segment.target: Key Encipherment

segment.source: Signature and encryption
segment.target: Signature and encryption

segment.source: GeneralPurposeTemplate
segment.target: GeneralPurposeTemplate

segment.source: Key Encipherment
segment.target: Key Encipherment

segment.source: Digital Signature
segment.target: Digital Signature

segment.source: For example, if the Purpose of your certificate template is Encryption, then edit the EncryptionTemplate value to be the name of your certificate template.
segment.target: For example, if the Purpose of your certificate template is Encryption, then edit the EncryptionTemplate value to be the name of your certificate template.

segment.source: After editing the registry, run iisreset on the server to force the server to pick up recent configuration changes.
segment.target: After editing the registry, run iisreset on the server to force the server to pick up recent configuration changes.

segment.source: To Install and bind certificates on the NDES Server
segment.target: To Install and bind certificates on the NDES Server

segment.source: On your NDES Server, request and install a server authentication certificate from your internal CA or public CA.
segment.target: On your NDES Server, request and install a server authentication certificate from your internal CA or public CA.

segment.source: You will then bind this SSL certificate in IIS.
segment.target: You will then bind this SSL certificate in IIS.

segment.source: After you bind the SSL certificate in IIS, you will also install a client authentication certificate.
segment.target: After you bind the SSL certificate in IIS, you will also install a client authentication certificate.

segment.source: This certificate can be issued by any CA that is trusted by the NDES Server.
segment.target: This certificate can be issued by any CA that is trusted by the NDES Server.

segment.source: Although it is not a best practice, you can use the same certificate for both server and client authentication as long as the certificate has both Enhance Key Usages (EKU’s).
segment.target: Although it is not a best practice, you can use the same certificate for both server and client authentication as long as the certificate has both Enhance Key Usages (EKU’s).

segment.source: Review the following steps for information about these authentication certificates.
segment.target: Review the following steps for information about these authentication certificates.

segment.source: After you obtain the server authentication certificate, open IIS Manager, select the Default Web Site in the Connections pane, and then click Bindings in the Actions pane.
segment.target: After you obtain the server authentication certificate, open IIS Manager, select the Default Web Site in the Connections pane, and then click Bindings in the Actions pane.

segment.source: Click Add, set Type to https, and then ensure the port is 443.
segment.target: Click Add, set Type to https, and then ensure the port is 443.

segment.source: (Only port 443 is supported for standalone ).
segment.target: (Only port 443 is supported for standalone ).

segment.source: For SSL certificate, specify the server authentication certificate.
segment.target: For SSL certificate, specify the server authentication certificate.

segment.source: If the NDES server uses both an external and internal name for a single network address, the server authentication certificate must have a Subject Name with an external public server name, and a Subject Alternative Name that includes the internal server name.
segment.target: If the NDES server uses both an external and internal name for a single network address, the server authentication certificate must have a Subject Name with an external public server name, and a Subject Alternative Name that includes the internal server name.

segment.source: On your NDES Server, request and install a client authentication certificate from your internal CA, or a public certificate authority.
segment.target: On your NDES Server, request and install a client authentication certificate from your internal CA, or a public certificate authority.

segment.source: This can be the same certificate as the server authentication certificate if that certificate has both capabilities.
segment.target: This can be the same certificate as the server authentication certificate if that certificate has both capabilities.

segment.source: The client authentication certificate must have the following properties:
segment.target: The client authentication certificate must have the following properties:

segment.source: Enhanced Key Usage - This must include Client Authentication.
segment.target: Enhanced Key Usage - This must include Client Authentication.

segment.source: Subject Name - This must be equal to the DNS name of the server where you are installing the certificate (the NDES Server).
segment.target: Subject Name - This must be equal to the DNS name of the server where you are installing the certificate (the NDES Server).

segment.source: To configure IIS Request Filtering
segment.target: To configure IIS Request Filtering

segment.source: On the NDES Server open IIS Manager, select the Default Web Site in the Connections pane, and then open Request Filtering.
segment.target: On the NDES Server open IIS Manager, select the Default Web Site in the Connections pane, and then open Request Filtering.

segment.source: Click Edit Feature Settings, and then set the following:
segment.target: Click Edit Feature Settings, and then set the following:

segment.source: query string (Bytes) = 65534
segment.target: query string (Bytes) = 65534

segment.source: Maximum URL length (Bytes) = 65534
segment.target: Maximum URL length (Bytes) = 65534

segment.source: Review the following registry key:
segment.target: Review the following registry key:

segment.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\HTTP\Parameters
segment.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\HTTP\Parameters

segment.source: Ensure the following values are set as DWORD entries:
segment.target: Ensure the following values are set as DWORD entries:

segment.source: Name: MaxFieldLength, with a decimal value of 65534
segment.target: Name: MaxFieldLength, with a decimal value of 65534

segment.source: Name: MaxRequestBytes, with a decimal value of 65534
segment.target: Name: MaxRequestBytes, with a decimal value of 65534

segment.source: Reboot the NDES server.
segment.target: Reboot the NDES server.

segment.source: The server is now ready to support the Certificate Connector.
segment.target: The server is now ready to support the Certificate Connector.

segment.source: Task 4 - Enable, install, and configure the Intune Certificate Connector - For SCEP and .PFX certificates.
segment.target: Task 4 - Enable, install, and configure the Intune Certificate Connector - For SCEP and .PFX certificates.

segment.source: In this task you will:
segment.target: In this task you will:

segment.source: Enable support for NDES in
segment.target: Enable support for NDES in

segment.source: Download, install, and configure the Certificate Connector on the NDES Server
segment.target: Download, install, and configure the Certificate Connector on the NDES Server

segment.source: To enable support for the Certificate Connector
segment.target: To enable support for the Certificate Connector

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, click Admin > Certificate Connector.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, click Admin > Certificate Connector.

segment.source: Click Configure On-Premises Certificate Connector.
segment.target: Click Configure On-Premises Certificate Connector.

segment.source: Select Enable Certificate Connector, and then click OK.
segment.target: Select Enable Certificate Connector, and then click OK.

segment.source: To download, install and configure the Certificate Connector
segment.target: To download, install and configure the Certificate Connector

segment.source: Open the Intune administration console, and then click Admin > Mobile Device Management > Certificate Connector > Download Certificate Connector.
segment.target: Open the Intune administration console, and then click Admin > Mobile Device Management > Certificate Connector > Download Certificate Connector.

segment.source: After the download completes, run the downloaded installer (ndesconnectorssetup.exe):
segment.target: After the download completes, run the downloaded installer (ndesconnectorssetup.exe):

segment.source: For .PFX certificates, run the installer on the computer that is able to connect with the Certification Authority.
segment.target: For .PFX certificates, run the installer on the computer that is able to connect with the Certification Authority.

segment.source: Choose the .PFX Distribution option then click Install.
segment.target: Choose the .PFX Distribution option then click Install.

segment.source: When the installation has completed, continue by creating a certificate profile as described in Configure certificate profiles.
segment.target: When the installation has completed, continue by creating a certificate profile as described in Configure certificate profiles.

segment.source: For SCEP certificates, run the installer on a Windows Server 2012 R2 server
segment.target: For SCEP certificates, run the installer on a Windows Server 2012 R2 server

segment.source: For the SCEP option, the installer also installs the policy module for NDES and the CRP Web Service.
segment.target: For the SCEP option, the installer also installs the policy module for NDES and the CRP Web Service.

segment.source: (The CRP Web Service, CertificateRegistrationSvc, runs as an application in IIS.)
segment.target: (The CRP Web Service, CertificateRegistrationSvc, runs as an application in IIS.)

segment.source: When you install NDES for standalone , the CRP service automatically installs with the Certificate Connector.
segment.target: When you install NDES for standalone , the CRP service automatically installs with the Certificate Connector.

segment.source: When you use with Configuration Manager, you install the Certificate Registration Point as a separate site system role.
segment.target: When you use with Configuration Manager, you install the Certificate Registration Point as a separate site system role.

segment.source: When prompted for the client certificate for the Certificate Connector, click Select, and select the client authentication certificate you installed on your NDES Server in Task 3.
segment.target: When prompted for the client certificate for the Certificate Connector, click Select, and select the client authentication certificate you installed on your NDES Server in Task 3.

segment.source: After you select the client authentication certificate, you are returned to the Client Certificate for Microsoft Intune Certificate Connector surface.
segment.target: After you select the client authentication certificate, you are returned to the Client Certificate for Microsoft Intune Certificate Connector surface.

segment.source: Although the certificate you selected is not shown, click Next to view the properties of that certificate.
segment.target: Although the certificate you selected is not shown, click Next to view the properties of that certificate.

segment.source: Then click Next, and then click Install.
segment.target: Then click Next, and then click Install.

segment.source: After the wizard completes, but before closing the wizard, click Launch the Certificate Connector UI.
segment.target: After the wizard completes, but before closing the wizard, click Launch the Certificate Connector UI.

segment.source: If you close the wizard before launching the Certificate Connector UI, you can reopen it by running the following command:
segment.target: If you close the wizard before launching the Certificate Connector UI, you can reopen it by running the following command:

segment.source: <install_Path>\NDESConnectorUI\NDESConnectorUI.exe
segment.target: <install_Path>\NDESConnectorUI\NDESConnectorUI.exe

segment.source: In the Certificate Connector UI:
segment.target: In the Certificate Connector UI:

segment.source: Click Sign In and enter your service administrator credentials, or credentials for a tenant administrator with the global administration permission.
segment.target: Click Sign In and enter your service administrator credentials, or credentials for a tenant administrator with the global administration permission.

segment.source: If your organization uses a proxy server and the proxy is needed for the NDES server to access the Internet, click Use proxy server and then provide the proxy server name, port, and account credentials to connect.
segment.target: If your organization uses a proxy server and the proxy is needed for the NDES server to access the Internet, click Use proxy server and then provide the proxy server name, port, and account credentials to connect.

segment.source: Select the Advanced tab, and then provide credentials for an account that has the Issue and Manage Certificates permission on your issuing Certificate Authority, and then click Apply.
segment.target: Select the Advanced tab, and then provide credentials for an account that has the Issue and Manage Certificates permission on your issuing Certificate Authority, and then click Apply.

segment.source: You can now close the Certificate Connector UI.
segment.target: You can now close the Certificate Connector UI.

segment.source: Open a command prompt and type services.msc, and then press Enter, right-click the Certificate Connector Service, and then click Restart.
segment.target: Open a command prompt and type services.msc, and then press Enter, right-click the Certificate Connector Service, and then click Restart.

segment.source: To validate that the service is running, open a browser and enter the following URL, which should return a 403 error:
segment.target: To validate that the service is running, open a browser and enter the following URL, which should return a 403 error:

segment.source: http:// <FQDN_of_your_NDES_server>/certsrv/mscep/mscep.dll
segment.target: http:// <FQDN_of_your_NDES_server>/certsrv/mscep/mscep.dll

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.source: You are now ready to configure certificate profiles, as described in Configure certificate profiles.
segment.target: You are now ready to configure certificate profiles, as described in Configure certificate profiles.
